alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Kent; Queen Anne's; Talbot (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 15 at 2:31AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...ELEVATED RISK OF WILDFIRE SPREAD WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING... A combination of low relative humidity, continued gusty northwest wind, and relatively dry fine fuels will lead to an elevated risk for fire spread Wednesday afternoon and early evening across Delaware and eastern Maryland. While dead and dormant vegetation in forested areas are still fairly moist, open fields more exposed to the wind will continue to dry out tonight into Wednesday. Minimum relative humidity values will be 25 to 30 percent Wednesday afternoon. The northwest wind will range from 15 to 20 MPH with gusts over 30 MPH at times. Residents are urged to exercise caution if handling any potential ignition source, including machinery, cigarettes, and matches. Be sure to properly discard all smoking materials. Any dry grasses, dead leaves, and other tree litter that ignite will have the potential to spread fire quickly. For more information about wildfire danger, burn restrictions, and wildfire prevention and education please visit your state`s forestry or environmental protection website.
